site_name: Pavement Outside65 High StreetNew MaldenKT3 4BT
description: Proposed installation of 1no. new BT Street Hub (following removal of associated BT kiosk)
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

No part of the development shall be made available for use until any damaged or altered areas of footway or other highway have been reinstated in accordance with Royal Borough of Kingston Council requirements. Reason: For the safety and convenience of pedestrians and other road users, and in accordance with policy Policies DM9 and DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).

The proposed Street Hub must be managed in accordance with the submitted BT Street Hub Anti-Social Behaviour Management Plan Version 2 and must include the ongoing use of an algorithm to identify repeated anti-social number use. The operator shall make available on reasonable request by the Council or the Metropolitan Police details of a review of the Management Plan 3 months after the first operation of the HUB. The review shall include the details of any changes required to the Management Plan to address any concerns raised by the Metropolitan Police. If any necessary changes to the Management Plan are identified they should be agreed in writing with the local planning authority (in consultation Metropolitan Police Designing Out Crime Team.) and the changes shall be brought into action within 6 months after the first operation of the HUB, or another timeframe to be agreed with the local planning authority.  Reason: To mitigate crime for all users, and in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan (2021), as well as Policies DM10 and CS14 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).

Prior to the first operation of the BT Street Hub hereby approved, the 'BT Telephone Booth' shown to be removed on 'Drawing Number 003, Rev A, Existing and Proposed Elevations' and 'Drawing Number 002, Rev A, Proposed Site Plan' shall be removed in its entirety and the areas of the footway and/or highway reinstated in accordance with Royal Borough of Kingston Council Requirements. Reason: To avoid a proliferation of street clutter and to ensure that the proposed development would have an acceptable impact on the character and appearance of the area in accordance with Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).
